article:
The 'Banat' is a geographical and historical region in Central Europe currently
divided between three countries: the eastern part lies in western Romania (the
counties of TimiÈ, CaraÈ-Severin, Arad south of the MureÈ, and MehedinÈi), the
western part in northeastern Serbia (the Serbian Banat, mostly included in
Vojvodina, except for a small part included in Belgrade Region), and a small
northern part in southeastern Hungary (CsongrÃ¡d county). It is populated by
Romanians, Serbs, Hungarians, Roma, Germans, Krashovani, Ukrainians, Slovaks,
Bulgarians, Czechs, Croats and other ethnicities.

The Banat is a part of the Pannonian Basin bordered by the River Danube to the
south, the River Tisa to the west, the River MureÈ to the north, and the
Southern Carpathian Mountains to the east. Its historical capital was TimiÈoara,
now in TimiÈ County in Romania.
